questions.question: ……………………. children need love.
questions.description: Use all before a plural noun. Every and whole are used with singular nouns.

questions.question: ……………………. individual is unique.
questions.description: Use every before a singular noun.

questions.question: …………………….. my friends are non-smokers.
questions.description: Either all or all of can be used before a noun with a determiner.

questions.question: I have invited …………………… my friends.
questions.description: Use all before a plural noun.

questions.question: I have written to ……………………… friend I have.
questions.description: Use every before a singular noun.

questions.question: He enjoys ……………………… music.
questions.description: Every cannot be used with uncountable nouns. All can be used with uncountable nouns.

questions.question: ……………………… Mumbai was under water.
questions.description: Either all or all of can be used here. All Mumbai means every part of Mumbai.

questions.question: The ………………………. of Mumbai was under water.
questions.description: All Mumbai means the same as the whole of Mumbai.

questions.question: I spent the ………………………. day at home.
questions.description: The whole day means the complete day.

questions.question: He lived his ……………………….. life in exile.
questions.description: Whole goes after the determiner all goes before the determiner.

questions.question: The cat has drunk ……………………….. the milk.
questions.description: We usually use all with uncountable nouns.

questions.question: I have just read the …………………… of Brothers Karamazov.
